messages.content: You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `routes/api.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostCommentController@store` is imported to process HTTP requests to the path `/v1/posts/{post}/comments`. I'll provide you with the contents of file `routes/api.php`, you have the option to execute additional Unix commands to gather more information if necessary, but you must not run the source code of the project, and your task is to find files that contain the implementation of `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\PostCommentController@store`. You must focus on the implementation itself and ignore unit tests or functional tests. You need to output a list of paths to the files that contain the handler implementations, ensuring that each path is relative to the project's directory. You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

function.name: run_command
function.description: Run a Unix command and get outputs in the project directory. You must not run any source code of the project.

message.content:
Files found (relative to project root)
- app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php

Explanation
- I searched the repository for PostCommentController class definitions and found two controller files:
  - app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php
  - app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php
- The route in routes/api.php references the namespaced controller App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\PostCommentController@store. The file that implements that namespace and contains the store handler is app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/PostCommentController.php. This file defines both index() and store() methods; store(CommentsRequest $request, Post $post) creates a comment and broadcasts a CommentPosted event.
- The other file (app/Http/Controllers/PostCommentController.php) is a different controller in the global App\Http\Controllers namespace used for web views; it only implements an index() method and does not contain the API store handler.
